d196effc-6cfd-4ab9-958c-6e27a4d84ac3

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - Only the <forward-request> policy element can appear within the <backend> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy position the cursor at the desired insertion point and click on the round button associated with the policy.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound></inbound>
  <backend>
    <forward-request />
  </backend>
  <outbound></outbound>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy fragment are included as-is whenever they are referenced.
    - If using variables. Ensure they are setup before use.
    - Copy and paste your code here or simply start coding
-->
<fragment>
	<set-header name="oid" exists-action="override">
		<value>@{
            string oid = "";
            string authHeader = context.Request.Headers.GetValueOrDefault("Authorization", "");
            if (authHeader?.Length > 0)
            {
                string[] authHeaderParts = authHeader.Split(' ');
                if (authHeaderParts?.Length == 2 && authHeaderParts[0].Equals("Bearer", StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase))
                {
                    Jwt jwt;
                    if (authHeaderParts[1].TryParseJwt(out jwt))
                    {
                        oid = (jwt.Claims.GetValueOrDefault("oid", ""));
                    }
                }
            }
            return oid;
            }</value>
	</set-header>
</fragment>

ruleDefinitions.Name: degradationindependencyduration
ruleDefinitions.Description: Smart Detection rules notify you of performance anomaly issues.

ruleDefinitions.Name: degradationinserverresponsetime
ruleDefinitions.Description: Smart Detection rules notify you of performance anomaly issues.

ruleDefinitions.Name: digestMailConfiguration
ruleDefinitions.Description: This rule describes the digest mail preferences

ruleDefinitions.Name: extension_billingdatavolumedailyspikeextension
ruleDefinitions.DisplayName: Abnormal rise in daily data volume (preview)
ruleDefinitions.Description: This detection rule automatically analyzes the billing data generated by your application, and can warn you about an unusual increase in your application's billing costs

ruleDefinitions.Name: extension_exceptionchangeextension
ruleDefinitions.Description: This detection rule automatically analyzes the exceptions thrown in your application, and can warn you about unusual patterns in your exception telemetry.

ruleDefinitions.Name: extension_memoryleakextension
ruleDefinitions.Description: This detection rule automatically analyzes the memory consumption of each process in your application, and can warn you about potential memory leaks or increased memory consumption.

ruleDefinitions.Name: extension_securityextensionspackage
ruleDefinitions.Description: This detection rule automatically analyzes the telemetry generated by your application and detects potential security issues.

ruleDefinitions.Name: extension_traceseveritydetector
ruleDefinitions.Description: This detection rule automatically analyzes the trace logs emitted from your application, and can warn you about unusual patterns in the severity of your trace telemetry.

ruleDefinitions.Name: longdependencyduration
ruleDefinitions.Description: Smart Detection rules notify you of performance anomaly issues.

ruleDefinitions.Name: migrationToAlertRulesCompleted
ruleDefinitions.Description: A configuration that controls the migration state of Smart Detection to Smart Alerts

ruleDefinitions.Name: slowpageloadtime
ruleDefinitions.Description: Smart Detection rules notify you of performance anomaly issues.

ruleDefinitions.Description: Smart Detection rules notify you of performance anomaly issues.

properties.displayName: All Computers with their most recent data
properties.query:
search not(ObjectName == "Advisor Metrics" or ObjectName == "ManagedSpace") | summarize AggregatedValue = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer | limit 500000 | sort by Computer asc
// Oql: NOT(ObjectName="Advisor Metrics" OR ObjectName=ManagedSpace) | measure max(TimeGenerated) by Computer | top 500000 | Sort Computer // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Which Management Group is generating the most data points?
properties.query:
search * | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by ManagementGroupName
// Oql: * | Measure count() by ManagementGroupName // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

search * | extend Type = $table | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Type
// Oql: * | Measure count() by Type // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

search not(ObjectName == "Advisor Metrics" or ObjectName == "ManagedSpace") | summarize lastdata = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer | limit 500000 | where lastdata < ago(24h)
// Oql: NOT(ObjectName="Advisor Metrics" OR ObjectName=ManagedSpace) | measure max(TimeGenerated) as lastdata by Computer | top 500000 | where lastdata < NOW-24HOURS // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

Event | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

Syslog | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Syslog // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: All Syslog Records grouped by Facility
properties.query:
Syslog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Facility
// Oql: Type=Syslog | Measure count() by Facility // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: All Syslog Records grouped by ProcessName
properties.query:
Syslog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by ProcessName
// Oql: Type=Syslog | Measure count() by ProcessName // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

Syslog | where SeverityLevel == "error" | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Syslog SeverityLevel=error // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Events in the Operations Manager Event Log whose Event ID is in the range between 2000 and 3000
properties.query:
Event | where EventLog == "Operations Manager" and EventID >= 2000 and EventID <= 3000 | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventLog="Operations Manager" EventID:[2000..3000] // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Count of Events containing the word "started" grouped by EventID
properties.query:
search in (Event) "started" | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by EventID
// Oql: Type=Event "started" | Measure count() by EventID // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Find the maximum time taken for each page
properties.query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = max(TimeTaken) by csUriStem
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Max(TimeTaken) by csUriStem // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: IIS Log Entries for a specific client IP Address (replace with your own)
properties.query:
search cIP == "192.168.0.1" | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | sort by TimeGenerated desc | project csUriStem, scBytes, csBytes, TimeTaken, scStatus
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog cIP="192.168.0.1" | Select csUriStem,scBytes,csBytes,TimeTaken,scStatus // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: How many connections to Operations Manager's SDK service by day
properties.query:
Event | where EventID == 26328 and EventLog == "Operations Manager" | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d) | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventID=26328 EventLog="Operations Manager" | Measure count() interval 1DAY // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: When did my servers initiate restart?
properties.query:
search in (Event) "shutdown" and EventLog == "System" and Source == "User32" and EventID == 1074 | sort by TimeGenerated desc | project TimeGenerated, Computer
// Oql: shutdown Type=Event EventLog=System Source=User32 EventID=1074 | Select TimeGenerated,Computer // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Shows which pages people are getting a 404 for
properties.query:
search scStatus == 404 | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csUriStem
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog scStatus=404 | Measure count() by csUriStem // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Shows servers that are throwing internal server error
properties.query:
search scStatus == 500 | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by sComputerName
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog scStatus=500 | Measure count() by sComputerName // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: Windows Firewall Policy settings have changed
properties.query:
Event | where EventLog == "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" and EventID == 2008 | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventLog="Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" EventID=2008 // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.displayName: On which machines and how many times have Windows Firewall Policy settings changed
properties.query:
Event | where EventLog == "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" and EventID == 2008 | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Computer | limit 500000
// Oql: Type=Event EventLog="Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" EventID=2008 | measure count() by Computer | top 500000 // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.value:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <set-header name="x-ms-smartenhanced-sample" exists-action="override">
      <value>true</value>
    </set-header>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <set-variable name="uti" value="@{
            var accessToken = context.Request.Body.As<string>();
            string uti = "";
            if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(accessToken))
            {
                Jwt token = accessToken.AsJwt();
                uti = token.Claims.GetValueOrDefault("uti", "");
            }
            return uti;
        }" />
    <cache-store-value key="@("access" + ((string)context.Variables["uti"]))" value="true" duration="6000" caching-type="prefer-external" />
    <return-response>
      <set-status code="204" reason="No Content" />
    </return-response>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <!-- Default to our Auth Function -->
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="smartAuth" />
    <rewrite-uri template="/appConsentInfo" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <!-- Default to our Auth Function -->
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="smartAuth" />
    <rewrite-uri template="/appConsentInfo" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <!-- Default to our Auth Function -->
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="smartAuth" />
    <rewrite-uri template="/appConsentInfo" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <!-- Default to our Auth Function -->
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="smartAuth" />
    <rewrite-uri template="/authorize" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
    <!-- When standalone launch, redirect to context static app (if not from there already) -->
    <choose>
      <when condition="@(context.Request.OriginalUrl.QueryString.Contains("launch") && context.Request.OriginalUrl.Query.GetValueOrDefault("user") != "true" )">
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="303" reason="Redirecting" />
          <set-header name="Location" exists-action="override">
            <value>@("https://" + context.Request.OriginalUrl.Host + "/auth/context/" + context.Request.OriginalUrl.QueryString)</value>
          </set-header>
        </return-response>
      </when>
    </choose>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@(context.Request.Url.Query.ContainsKey("aud") == true && System.Net.WebUtility.UrlDecode(context.Request.Url.Query.GetValueOrDefault("aud", "")).Equals("{{Audience}}", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) == false)">
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="400" reason="Invalid audience" />
        </return-response>
      </when>
    </choose>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <!-- Default to our Auth Function -->
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="smartAuth" />
    <rewrite-uri template="/context-cache" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <!-- Default to our Auth Function -->
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="smartAuth" />
    <rewrite-uri template="/context-cache" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="contextFrontentAppBackend" />
    <rewrite-uri template="@((context.Request.OriginalUrl.Path).Replace("auth/context/", ""))" copy-unmatched-params="true" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.

    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <set-backend-service base-url="https://b2324-customoperations-func.azurewebsites.net/api/" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
    <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
      <value>application/json</value>
    </set-header>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@(context.Response.StatusCode == 200)">
        <set-body>@{
                    // Get response body and flag the oauth URLs as SMART compatible
                    var responseBody = context.Response.Body.As<JObject>();
                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["extension"][0]["url"] = "http://fhir-registry.smarthealthit.org/StructureDefinition/oauth-uris";

                    // Set Metadata
                    responseBody["url"] = $"https://{context.Request.OriginalUrl.Host}/smart/metadata";

                    // Replace OAuth security with SMART security service
                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["service"][0]["coding"][0]["code"] = "SMART-on-FHIR";

                    // Reroute SMART OAuth Urls
                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["extension"][0]["extension"][0]["url"] = "token";
                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["extension"][0]["extension"][0]["valueUri"] = $"https://{context.Request.OriginalUrl.Host}/auth/token";
                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["extension"][0]["extension"][1]["url"] = "authorize";
                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["extension"][0]["extension"][1]["valueUri"] = $"https://{context.Request.OriginalUrl.Host}/auth/authorize";

                    // Add the token revocation URL
                    var revoke = new JObject(
                        new JProperty("valueUri", "revoke"),
                        new JProperty("url", "https://graph.microsoft.com/{version}/users/{userobject_id}/invalidateAllRefreshToken")
                    );

                    responseBody["rest"][0]["security"]["extension"][0]["extension"][1].AddAfterSelf(revoke);

                    // Add bulk data
                    string instantiatesJson = @"[
                        'http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/CapabilityStatement/us-core-server',
                        'http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/bulkdata/CapabilityStatement/bulk-data'
                    ]";
                    responseBody["instantiates"] = JArray.Parse(instantiatesJson);

                    var group = responseBody["rest"][0].SelectToken("$.resource[?(@.type=='Group')]");
                    group["operation"] = JToken.Parse("[{'name':'export','definition':'http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/bulkdata/OperationDefinition/group-export'}]");

                    return responseBody.ToString();
                }</set-body>
      </when>
    </choose>
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <return-response>
      <set-status code="200" />
      <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
        <value>application/json</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-body template="liquid">
{
    "color_background": "#000000",
    "color_error": "#9e2d2d",
    "color_highlight": "#69b5ce",
    "color_modal_backdrop": "",
    "color_success": "#498e49",
    "color_text": "#303030",
    "dim_border_radius": "6px",
    "dim_font_size": "13px",
    "dim_spacing_size": "20px",
    "font_family_body": "Georgia, Times, 'Times New Roman', serif",
    "font_family_heading": "'HelveticaNeue-Light', Helvetica, Arial, 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif;"
}
            </set-body>
    </return-response>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <rewrite-uri template="/metadata" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
    <set-body template="liquid">{
            "issuer": "https://login.microsoftonline.com/{{TenantId}}/v2.0",
            "jwks_uri": "https://login.microsoftonline.com/{{TenantId}}/discovery/v2.0/keys",
            "authorization_endpoint": "https://{{context.Request.OriginalUrl.Host}}/auth/authorize",
            "token_endpoint": "https://{{context.Request.OriginalUrl.Host}}/auth/token",
            "token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported": [
                "client_secret_basic",
                "private_key_jwt"
            ],
            "grant_types_supported": [
                "authorization_code",
                "client_credentials"
            ],
            "scopes_supported": ["openid", "profile", "launch", "launch/patient", "patient/*.rs", "user/*.rs", "offline_access", "fhirUser", "need_patient_banner", "smart_style_url"],
            "response_types_supported": ["code"],
            "code_challenge_methods_supported": ["S256"],
            "capabilities": [
                "launch-ehr",
                "permission-patient",
                "client-public",
                "client-confidential-symmetric",
                "context-ehr-patient",
                "sso-openid-connect",
                "launch-standalone",
                "context-standalone-patient",
                "permission-offline",
                "context-banner",
                "context-style",
                "permission-user"
            ]
        }</set-body>
    <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
      <value>application/json</value>
    </set-header>
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>
